projects.text:
This is a clothing website I developed for New York City designer Stacy Chang. This uses a fully responsive custom design, coded on the Shopify e-commerse platform.

Other e-commerse websites I coded using Shopify are:

Swing Shopping

Señor Tyrone

Slow and Low
projects.title: Shop The Lookbook
Game Shakers
projects.text:
My most recent in a series of websites for Nickelodeon TV shows. I coded a completely responsive front end using Haml and Sass, and a neat ruby framework called Middleman. This site uses image sprites that are dynamically generated using compass from individual images stored in git.

Other Nickelodeon show sites which I worked extensively on the front end for include icarly.com, theslap.com, and samandcat.com.

projects.title: Metallica on Spotify
projects.text:
The quintessential heavy metal band Metallica released their full music catalog for web streaming in December of 2012, after years of boycotting internet music. At the time, I worked with Spotify to code this promotional page to exhibit Metallica's complete catalog, that was linked to on Spotify's homepage.

I later coded another Metallica Spotify promotion page to promote the movie and soundtrack release of Metallica: Through The Never

projects.title: Ventucom
projects.text:
One of my first Ruby on Rails sites with a custom content management system (CMS). It has semi-responsive design (big deal in 2012), and the contact page has some simple & effective spam protection.

Another website I coded in Ruby on Rails is Live Wire Farm

projects.title: Señor Tyrone
projects.text: This is a Shopify e-commerse website. It's based a template that I customized to fill the client's needs.

projects.title: Gary + Dana
projects.text:
A personal website I built for my 2014 wedding. It was initially used for guests RSVPs and information.

Afterwards, the site was transitioned to share wedding photos, music and video, and baby photos.
